content.raw:
So this is saying that we expect the robot not to have moved very much? The PID controller could be totally disabled, and this test would pass.

Is the point of this test to ensure that the effort limit is working? It would make more sense to have a large limit, verify that it moves, then reduce the limit and verify that it doesn't move so much.

We could potentially use the `Model::GetJointController()` function to directly verify that the PID values are set properly from the messages.
content.html:
So this is saying that we expect the robot not to have moved very much? The PID controller could be totally disabled, and this test would pass.

Is the point of this test to ensure that the effort limit is working? It would make more sense to have a large limit, verify that it moves, then reduce the limit and verify that it doesn't move so much.

We could potentially use the Model::GetJointController() function to directly verify that the PID values are set properly from the messages.
